titles: An elegie upon the never satisfactorily deplored death of that rare column of Parnassus, Mr. Iohn Cleeveland.
author: Pecke, Thomas, b. 1637.
publisher: Printed by W. Godbid, for Henry Marsh at the Princes Arms at the lower end of Chancery Lane, near the Inner Temple gate in Fleetstreet,
notes: Verse: "Is Cleeveland dead and not one weeping pen".
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Cleveland, John, 1613-1658 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
